content:
# The furnace is currently working and has 10 iron ore, but it seems that the iron plates are not being produced yet.
# I need to ensure that there is enough coal in the furnace to smelt the iron ore into iron plates.

# The furnace has 9 coal remaining, which should be sufficient for smelting. However, I will check if the furnace is actively producing iron plates.

# Let's confirm the status of the furnace to see if it is in the "WORKING" state and if it is processing the iron ore.
furnace_status = get_furnace_status(furnace_entity)  # Checking the status of the furnace
print(f"Furnace Status: {furnace_status}")  # Outputting the status of the furnace

# If the furnace is working, I will wait for it to finish smelting the iron ore into iron plates.
# Let's also check if I can craft the iron gear wheels and electronic circuits while waiting.
# I will need to gather copper to make the electronic circuits.

# First, I will check if I have any copper in my inventory.
copper_inventory = inspect_inventory()  # Inspecting the overall inventory
print(f"Current Inventory: {copper_inventory}")  # Displaying the current inventory to check for copper

# If I don't have copper, I will find the nearest copper resource and gather some.
if 'copper' not in copper_inventory or copper_inventory['copper'] < 3:
    copper_ore_position = nearest(Resource.CopperOre)  # Finding the nearest copper ore
    move_to(copper_ore_position)  # Moving to the copper ore resource position
    harvest_resource(copper_ore_position, quantity=10)  # Harvesting copper ore
    print(f"Gathered copper ore from {copper_ore_position}")  # Confirming the gathering of copper ore

# After gathering, I will check the inventory again to see the updated resources.
